definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to exorcise/to drive out evil spirits

sentences.english: The excess that they encountered during the exorcism was so excessive.
sentences.chinese: 驅魔期間他們遇到了過多的過度行爲。

sentences.english: You know there's not one exorcism in the Gospel of John.
sentences.chinese: 在約翰福音中則絲毫沒有提到驅魔。

sentences.english: He's exorcising demons,performs a few miracles,he heals people.
sentences.chinese: 他還會驅魔，創造奇蹟，治療民衆。

sentences.english: Talk to her and frankly in Thailand, then shaineh falls into exorcisms shut.
sentences.chinese: 跟她說在泰國，然後仙娜落入驅魔關閉。

sentences.english: He's performed more than 70,000 exorcisms in his career, he estimates.
sentences.chinese: 據他估計，他已經實施了超過七萬次的驅魔儀式。

sentences.english: What an excellent day for an exorcism.
sentences.chinese: 真是做法驅魔的好日子。

definition: General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
